title: The Huddle: ReGenesis holding women's health day
content: Saturday  Jun 2, 2018 at 5:29 PM      ReGenesis is holding a women's health day in Spartanburg on June 13 to screen for breast and cervical cancer.    Qualifying women are 21 years or older, have no health insurance, haven't had a mammogram in the past year, haven't had a pap smear in the past three years, and haven't had a hysterectomy.    You do not have to be a ReGenesis patient to schedule a screening. Any woman between ages 40-64 qualifies, regardless of their ability to pay. Other women may qualify for assistance through the Best Chance Network.    Screenings will be held from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. June 13 at ReGenesis Health Care, 460 Langdon St., Spartanburg.    Call 864-582-2411 for more information or to schedule an appointment.    There will be similar events in July in Woodruff and in August in Gaffney.    ****    Jerry Bridges wanted to share that everyone is welcome to a gospel music worship at Boiling Springs First Baptist Church at 6:30 p.m. Sunday. The church is on Highway 9, and no ticket is required.    ****    Have an event, some information, or a group you’d like to highlight in The Huddle? Have a question you’d like us to answer or a joke you’d like to share? Email us at huddle@shj.com.
